greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest perfect power divisor of n.
comment: This sequence shares many elements with A057521, but is not identical: A057521(72)=72 but a(72)=36.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: if isA001597(d) then # implemented in A001597
mathematica: Table[If[SquareFreeQ[n], 1, s = FactorInteger[n]; Max[Table[Times @@ Cases[s, {p_, ep_} :> p^i /; (ep >= i)], {i, 2, Max[s[[All, 2]]]}]]], {n, 100}] (* _Olivier Gerard_, Jun 03 2016 *)
results.author: _Antonio Roldán_, Dec 28 2011
ext: Values matching definition restored by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 06 2016
